projectPurpose: To serve as the core decentralized infrastructure or "operating system" specifically designed for building, deploying, and running zero-knowledge proof-based applications.
mainFeatures: Decentralized operating system for ZK applications
Forms the backbone of the Aleo network
Verifies transactions with a single proof of execution
Stores encrypted application state in a publicly-verifiable manner
Supports different node types (Client, Prover, Validator)

alternatives.name: Polygon zkEVM
mainFeatures: Leverages zk-SNARKs for transaction bundling and verification

mostWellKnownAlternative: Ethereum (with ZK-Rollups like zkSync and Polygon zkEVM)
marketPositioning: snarkOS positions itself as a Layer 1 decentralized operating system specifically built for zero-knowledge applications, forming the core of the Aleo network. Unlike Layer 2 ZK-rollups that scale existing chains like Ethereum, snarkOS aims to provide a native, privacy-focused, and programmable environment optimized for ZK computations from the ground up. It competes directly with other Layer 1 blockchains emphasizing privacy and ZK technology, and indirectly with Layer 2 ZK solutions that offer scalability and privacy features on established networks.
